executiveSummary: Aaliyah Marendis, founder of Sugardoh from Austin, Texas, pitched her natural sugaring hair removal brand seeking $500,000 for 5% equity. Despite impressive sales growth from $50K in 2020 to $5.6M in 2022, the Sharks declined to invest due to high debt ($1.5M), lack of profitability, and an overvalued $10M valuation.
nextSteps: Aaliyah plans to continue growing Sugardoh independently, improving margins, and expanding into more retailers to prove the Sharks wrong about the companyâ€™s potential.
